text: Legitimacy, from the Latin legitimare meaning "to make lawful", may refer to: * Legitimacy (criminal law) * Legitimacy (family law) ** Legitimacy law in England and Wales, legitimacy (family law) in England and Wales * Legitimacy (political) == See also == * Bastard (law of England and Wales) * Illegitimacy in fiction * Legit (disambiguation) * Legitimate (professional wrestling) * Legitimate expectation * Legitimate peripheral participation * Legitimate theater * Legitimation * Legitime * Nomen illegitimum in botany is a valid published name that contravenes the international articles * Sources of law
title: Legitimacy
